issue.title: [Rust][DataFusion] Catalog abstraction
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-10902](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-10902). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
This issue is intended to be a design discussion around the introduction of the notion of data catalog into DataFusion.

 

A first draft containing some observations can be found here: [https://docs.google.com/document/d/1dy2eiJDtmhEHKit1ekR-7_LguMO8z-72ORIPCCIHWOo/edit#](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1dy2eiJDtmhEHKit1ekR-7_LguMO8z-72ORIPCCIHWOo/edit?usp=sharing)

 

To add a bit of context, a higher level description of DataFusion's interfaces can be found here: <https://docs.google.com/document/d/1S5bR48Apzvp1cXOVrlk-YJnc-Aml-IapRrEs3cLvz6c/edit?usp=sharing>

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-10902?focusedCommentId=17249064) by Rémi Dettai (rdettai):*
If anyone wants write access, feel free to ask!

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-10902?focusedCommentId=17249089) by Rémi Dettai (rdettai):*
Catalogs typically associate to each partition/file an expression bounding the content (min/max statistics). To assert which partitions/files will need to be processed from the catalog, some sort of constant folding as that mentioned in ARROW-9770 can be used.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-10902?focusedCommentId=17332320) by Andrew Lamb (alamb):*
